intro: Anderbergia ustulata, commonly known as the scorched sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has adapted to harsh, dry environments with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, rounded fruits that contain seeds. Anderbergia ustulata is often found in sandy soils and is a hardy species that thrives in low-nutrient conditions.
